intro: Wimmeria integerrima, commonly known as the smooth wimmeria, is a rare and lesser-known member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in late spring. Native to specific regions of southern Africa, this plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial shade. Its unique morphology makes it a subject of interest for botanists studying plant adaptation and evolution. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Wimmeria integerrima is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
